Thanks. I tried the setenv command from 'run', but come to think of it I was
already in the GUI environment, and that command only works in DOS.

- al
-----Original Message-----
From: Vladimir Bossicard +ADw-vladimir+AEA-bossicard.com+AD4-
To: junit+AEA-yahoogroups.com +ADw-junit+AEA-yahoogroups.com+AD4-
Date: Wednesday, October 03, 2001 4:55 PM
Subject: Re: +AFs-junit+AF0- Limitation on Home Installation of Junit


+AD4APg- I'd like to use Junit at home on my WIN95 machine, but
+AD4APg- I have to rely on the /ext folder because I can't set a CLASSPATH in that
+AD4APg- environment.
+AD4-
+AD4-- edit the autoexec.bat file (c:+AFw-autoexec.bat)
+AD4-- setenv CLASSPATH+AD0-c:+AFw-progra+AH4-1+AFw-junit+AFw-junit.jar (or 'set' I don't remember)
+AD4-- save the file
+AD4-
+AD4-the 'classpath' is simply an environment variable.
+AD4-
+AD4-What I used to have in my autoexec.bat:
+AD4-
+AD4-setenv JDK+AD0AWw-...+AF0AXA-jdk1.2
+AD4-setenv JUNIT+AD0AWw-...+AF0AXA-junit
+AD4-setenv PROJECT+AF8-X+AD0AWw-...+AF0AXA-ProjectX
+AD4-setenv CLASSPATH+AD0AJQ-JDK+ACUAXA-bin+ADsAJQ-JUNIT+ACUAXA-junit.jar+ADsAJQ-PROJECT+AF8-X+ACUAXA-build
+AD4-
+AD4--Vladimir
+AD4-
